questionText: What Polynesian-themed casino on the Las Vegas Strip, the permanent home of âThe Beatles: LOVE,â gets its name from the false vision of water that is often seen in the desert?

Members of The Who must be thankful that the âCSIâ franchise keeps expanding. From the original, to Miami, to New York, to Cyber, and now back to Las Vegas, over 800 episodes of this forensic procedural have aired. What does CSI stand for?
What Las Vegas Strip hotel shares its name with a cocktail as well as the magazine whose slogan is "Fun, fearless, female?"
In January 2004, what pop star married her childhood friend Jason Alexander in Vegas, only to end the marriage 55 hours later and marry Kevin Federline later the same year?
What hotel and casino, located on the Las Vegas Strip and home to the Azilo Pool and Chickie & Peteâs Sports Bar, is named after the largest hot desert in the world?
Palms Casino, a Las Vegas resort and spa, is located on what âFâ Road, also the name of a pink shrimp-eating bird that likes to stand on one foot?
The National Museum Of Organized Crime, located on Stewart Ave in Downtown Las Vegas, is better known as the museum of what related nickname?

If youâre in Vegas and need some fuel for your risk-taking adventures, head to Evel Pie on Fremont St. The pizzeria is a wall-to-wall tribute of memorabilia devoted to which death-defying daredevil?
What casino on the southern end of the Las Vegas Strip is named after the mythical sword of King Arthur, and features a medieval theme throughout its property?

What hotel and casino owned by Caesars Entertainment is the oldest casino still on the Strip, opening in 1946? Its permanent shows include Paula Abdul, as well as âRuPaulâs Drag Race Live,â and it is named after a pink bird who stands on one leg.
What âWâ resort on Las Vegas Boulevard, named after co-founder Steve, has a four-letter name that is a homophone of the opposite of âloss?â
Getting a college degree might not be your top reason to go to Vegas, but which state university has a campus there?
Most of Las Vegas's water supply comes from what large lake created when the Hoover Dam was built in 1935?
"Austin Lee Russell" is the real name of what reality TV star and Las Vegas businessman, the comic foil of the History Channel show âPawn Starsâ?
Add one letter to "Las Vegas" to get the title of what 2013 film, in which Michael Douglas, Robert De Niro, Morgan Freeman, and Kevin Kline play a group of friends having one final bachelor party?
"Think âAntiques Roadshow,â but with neon and far more tattoos." That's how People Magazine described what reality show that's filmed at a 24-hour shop in Las Vegas?
Played by Dustin Hoffman, autistic brother Raymond counts cards at blackjack in Las Vegas to win enough money to pay off his brother Charlie's debts in what 1988 film?
Loftier than Russia's Sun of Moscow and the London Eye, the world's second-tallest fixed Ferris wheel is the High Roller overlooking what pretty guessable U.S. city?

What Canyon and National Conservation Area in Las Vegas has sandstone peaks, the Keystone Thrust Fault, and Native American petroglyphs? It gets its alliterative name from its formations having a distinct color.

optionalAnswers.text: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area

questionText: In the Fremont Street Experience in Las Vegas, SlotZilla offers two different versions of what thrilling experience, a pulley on a stainless steel cable, allowing users to ride down a slope while high in the air?
What Major League Baseball team announced in 2023 that it had purchased land near the Las Vegas Strip, with the intention of moving there by 2027?

She's not known as the "Queen of Las Vegas" for nothing. Which Quebecois singer's "A New Day..." residency in Las Vegas between 2003 and 2007 grossed over $385 million, making it the most successful concert residency of all time?

In 2022, the Nevada Gaming Control Board reported that there were 47,770 of what kind of slot machine in Vegas? (Hint: In terms of how much you have to pay to play, theyâre probably the cheapest next to freeâ¦)
What 2009 movie comedy was filmed mostly on site at Caesar's Palace, including the lobby, pools, and elevators, although the suite damaged during the film was built on a soundstage?
What Las Vegas hotel and casino, located in Las Vegas, Nevada at the southern end of the Strip, is owned by MGM Resorts and has an Egyptian theme, complete with a pyramid and a Sphinx?

Later in his life, Tony Hsieh's work included the Downtown Project, a revitalization effort for the central business district of Las Vegas. His connection to the city was previously cemented as the CEO of what alphabetically opposite online shoe retailer that Amazon scooped up in 2009?
Also the name of a hotel in Las Vegas, what four-letter word that means "air" in Italian is the name for a song for a solo singer in an opera?
In which Las Vegas Valley community will you find the Red Rock Natural Conservation Area, the Warsaw Ghetto Remembrance Garden, and the Las Vegas Ballpark?
Are you ready for some football? At the time that he became the NFL's first openly gay player, defensive lineman Carl Nassib played for what Vegas team?
What Las Vegas Casino includes two towers named Octavius and Forum?
A cool $250,000 buys a VIP night including Jay-Z branded champagne and the right to control the famous fountains of what Las Vegas Strip hotel?

What casino chain, particularly popular with local Nevada residents, was founded in 1976 by Frank Fertitta Jr., and purchased the Palms Casino in 2016? Despite its name, you cannot catch a train there.
Featuring old signs from casinos and other businesses and named after the 10th element on the Periodic Table, what museum opened in 2012 in Las Vegas?
In 1998, the lights on the Strip went down and casinos paused play for one minute to mark the death of which blue-eyed who may have loved the Big Apple, but whose home-away-from-home was the Sands?
The Washington Capitals defeated what team in the 2018 Stanley Cup Finals? This losing team was playing in its inaugural season.

What Las Vegas hotel and casino, opened in 1993 and owned by Phil Ruffin, is home to the Marvel Avengers S.T.A.T.I.O.N, and used to have a giant sign of a skeleton head wearing pirate garb? Its name is the same as a Robert Louis Stevenson book.
What was the former name of the now current Planet Hollywood resort, which operated from 1962 to 1997, and shared its name with a Disney character?
Although the band was formed at Brigham Young University in Utah, Vegas native Dan Reynolds brought it back to his native Las Vegas in 2009: what "It's Time" band has been rooted in Vegas ever since?
Born in Dallas in 1965, what was the name of the ventriloquist who won Americaâs Got Talent in 2007, and went on to headline at hotels in Las Vegas?
In 2012, Nevada added a new area code to make sure that there were enough phone numbers to go around in Vegas. The first was 702. What was the second one they added as an overlay?
Artist residencies are quite common in Vegas. What pianist pioneered the concept, starting with concerts in 1944?
"Leaving Las Vegas" was a single from the 1993 album "Tuesday Night Music Club" by what Grammy-winning singer?
You can check out the glittery Stardust and Hard Rock Casino guitar signs at a Las Vegas museum named for what chemical element with the atomic number 10?

What Street Experience is a pedestrian mall and attraction, offering attractions on its namesake downtown Las Vegas street, such as Glitter Gulch? The street shares the name of the explorer who was the Republican candidate for president in 1856.
E Fremont Street is home to what Las Vegas hotel and casino, whose two-word name is better known as the name of a bridge across the San Francisco Bay?
What street in Las Vegas, now home to an "experience," was also the home of the first hotel in Las Vegas, as well as the first telephone and paved street in the city?

Formerly known as the âHorseshoeâ which Hotel and Gambling Hall on Freemont Street has been a fixture there since the 1950âs when it was started by a casino icon with a double-B name (obviously, he used his familyâs name for the place!)?
Currently at the Park MGM, "My Way" is the Las Vegas residency of what one-named R&B star whose hits include "You Make Me Wanna..." and "U Got It Bad?"
What was the name of John O'Brien's memoir, ironically about a journey from Los Angeles to Las Vegas, which was later made into an Academy Award-winning film?

optionalAnswers.text: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas

questionText: What annual competition dates back to 1970, when casino magnate Benny Binion invited seven of the world's best players to face off at the Horseshoe Casino?
The recreation of which famous Egyptian landmark at Luxor is actually taller than the original (by two stories!)?
Las Vegas native Matthew Gray Gubler played a character named Spencer Reid (who was likewise a Vegas native) in what CBS police procedural that ran from 2005 to 2020?

What âAâ Las Vegas resort and casino, part of the CityCenter complex, has two curved glass and steel high-rise towers at its center? Opening in 2009, it shares its name with a long opera song, designed to accompany a solo voice.
Swamp Thing, Diamond Dog, and Grissom escape on fire trucks after a massive plane crash on the Vegas Strip at the end of what breakout hit 1997 Nic Cage movie?
What classic Las Vegas hotel with a repetitive name is known for its big-top architecture and allows its guests to watch free live acts like trapeze artists and juggling masters?

Russell Road and Sahara Avenue are the southern and northern boundaries of what 4.2 mile stretch of road popular with tourists in the Southwestern US? Itâs where people can âsâee amazing shows, garish architecture, and how to lose their money.
What Las Vegas bank is the world's leading investment bank and advisory firm centered on the gaming industry? It sounds like it was on the right side of the US Civil War.
What hotel, casino, and skypod in Las Vegas contains the tallest observation tower in the US? Its name is a shortening of its former name, also a name for a layer of Earthâs atmosphere.
"Viva Las Vegas", the 1964 song made for the movie "Viva Las Vegas", was originally recorded by what legendary American rock and roll musician?
OneOf's poker chip NFTs celebrate the iHeartRadio Music Festival in what guessable city?
"The Inside Story of Six MIT Students Who Took Vegas for Millions" is the subtitle of what 2003 Ben Mezrich nonfiction book about a group of savvy card counters?
Of many unique attractions, Las Vegas is also home to what restaurant synonymous with a kind of power outage, where customers can dine in the dark?
In fall 2020, Bobby Flay shut down his classic Las Vegas restaurant, Mesa Grill, to renovate it into what restaurant with an Italian menu?

Las Vegas is home to a Hall Of Fame for what type of game, during which a plunger launches the titular object onto a playing field, and it is subsequently pushed upwards by paddles? Examples include âThe Addams Familyâ and âThe Twilight Zoneâ machines.
Harry Reid International Airport, Allegiant Stadium, and most of the Las Vegas Strip are actually not located in Las Vegas, but instead located in what other census-designated place?

Among his other accomplishments, Las Vegas native Aaron Fotheringham is the first person to do a backflip using what kind of transportation device? Fotheringham competes against skateboarders and BMX riders in this conveyance.
What successful Las Vegas-based brand, which was founded in 1999 as Shoesite.com, was purchased by Amazon in 2009 for $1.2 billion?
What power forward for the Las Vegas Aces won the WNBA's MVP award in 2020?
Mystere, Mad Apple, and O are three shows operated in Las Vegas by what contemporary circus company?
What post-apocalyptic fantasy novel by Stephen King features a totalitarian society run by the villain Randall Flagg in the ruins of Las Vegas?
At the Luxor Hotel, you can see over 200 artifacts, not including a sapphire heart necklace, from what famous sea disaster?
Classic car lovers and vintage racing fans can get a private tour of which museum on Ensworth Street?
The Ethel M Chocolate Factory in Henderson, Nevada is named for the matriarch of what American first family of chocolate?
The Bellagio Hotel in Las Vegas is home to the worldâs largest fountain of which dark, white, or semi-sweet confection?
What Las Vegas casino includes a roller coaster, which wends its way through faux skyscrapers and a 1/3 scale replica of the Statue of Liberty?

Mainly set in "Sin City," the 1997 movie "Vegas Vacation"is the fourth film in the National Lampoon cinematic series which centers around the misadventures of what family featuring Chevy Chase and Beverly D'Angelo portraying Clark and Ellen, the clan's patriarch and matriarch?
In 1907, the Hotel Nevada, now known as the Golden Gate Casino, became the site of the first instance of what technological innovation in Nevada?
What private rail company, which already runs passenger trains in Florida, has officially proposed to build a bullet train between Las Vegas and Los Angeles?
What canyon south of Las Vegas has been called the "Sistine Chapel of Native American rock art" thanks to its collection of ancient petroglyphs?
What Las Vegas establishment was the first to receive a Nevada gaming license? The club later went by various other names before it closed (as La Bayou) in 2016.
Which famous Food Network dude is âMayorâ of the Flavortown Sports Kitchen, which is inside the Horseshoe in Vegas?
Tule Springs Fossil Beds National Monument north of Las Vegas protects the remains of ground sloths, Smilodons, and what prehistoric carnivores featured on Game of Thrones?
Although they were from Scotland, not Nevada, what indie rock band made Rolling Stone's 500 Greatest Albums of All Time with their 1990 album Heaven or Las Vegas?
The city of "New Vegas," built in the Mojave Desert on the ruins of what had been Las Vegas, is the setting of a 2010 video game in what popular series?

The temple of Karnak and the tomb complexes known as the "Valley of the Kings" and "Valley of the Queens" are some of the sites travelers can visit near what Egyptian city? (Less adventurous travelers can get a version of the experience in Las Vegas.)
Set to begin shutting down in 2026, the Ivanpah Solar Plant is located between Las Vegas and Los Angeles in what large desert?
Sioux Valley Dakota Nation member Zach Whitecloud signed with what recent NHL expansion team in 2018 as a college free agent and helped the âgildedâ franchise win its first Stanley Cup in 2023?
Las Vegasâs Flamingo hotel was built in 1945 under the supervision of what mobster who was one of the co-founders of Murder, Incorporated?
Carl Nassib, the first active NFL player to come out as gay, plays defensive end for what AFC West team?

What low cost airline, headquartered out of Las Vegas, is the named sponsor of the stadium currently being used by the Las Vegas Raiders of the NFL? Founded in 1997, their logo is the name written in blue letters, with a rising sun dotting the âIâ.
Founded in 2017, what shiny-sounding NHL expansion team is the first major professional sports team to represent Las Vegas?
What hotel at the southern end of the Las Vegas Strip is the location of the worldâs strongest light beam, visible from hundreds of miles away?
What is the High Roller, the world's tallest of its kind, located on the Las Vegas Strip?
What casino on the Strip, home to the "High Roller" observation wheel, was once known as "The Imperial Palace" and "The Quad"?
What author used the name "Raoul Duke" as a pseudonym for himself in the book âFear and Loathing in Las Vegasâ?
The Las Vegas Desert Dogs, a planned expansion team of the NLL, will be the first professional team in Vegas to play what sport?

The Las Vegas Aviators are a AAA baseball team, the minor league affiliate of what nearby Major League franchise? The team was chronicled in the book and film âMoneyballâ, and won the 1989 World Series behind Mark McGwire and Dennis Eckersley.
"Love and Honor in Las Vegas" is the subtitle of a Nicholas Pileggi book adapted into what aptly named 1995 Martin Scorsese film?
Who served as mayor of Las Vegas from 1999 to 2011, before being succeeded by his wife?
Which historic landmark was the first non-native settlement in Vegas and features a wartime construct built by missionaries of a particular religious background?

optionalAnswers.text: First Baptist Mission of Las Vegas

questionText: What rapper and musician made the news after throwing a microphone at a fan, who threw a drink on the star, at a Las Vegas show in July 2023?
Kurt and Kyle are Vegas-born brothers who have three NASCAR Cup championships between them, and who share what last name?
"Vegas" and "Vegas 2," in which the namesake team travels to Las Vegas to hunt down international terrorist Irena Morales, are the 17th and 18th installments in what popular video game series?

Gwen Stefani, Elvis Presley, and Siegfried and Roy are some of the celebrities who make a rather stiff and uncommunicative appearance at what museum which opened in The Venetian in 1999, its first U.S. outpost?
What HBO Max series features Hannah Einbinder as Ava Daniels, a young comedy writer tasked with saving the Las Vegas stage show of a legendary older comedian?
Taking its name from a local gambling hall, "Sam's Town" was the second album dropped by what "Hot Fuss" Las Vegas alt-rock band?

Hyped as "The Showdown" at which famous Las Vegas locale did an epic boxing match between Sugar Ray Leonard and Thomas Hearns take place in September of 1981? (If you werenât there in person, maybe you were one of the 300 million people who watched it on TV).
What Vegas brewery takes its name from the first two atomic bombs detonated at the Nevada test site?

optionalAnswers.text: Fat Man and Little Boy Brewery

questionText: 40,000 acres of bright red sandstone give what state park outside of Las Vegas its name?

optionalAnswers.text: Las Vegas Red Rock State Park

questionText: What 1992 film, a sequel to a family science fiction comedy from 1989, features the spectacle of a giant two-year-old causing havoc along Las Vegas's Fremont Street?
Outlasting their opponents 3-1 in the Championship series, the Las Vegas Aces defeated what Eastern Conference team coached by Sandy Brondello in the 2023 WNBA Finals?
What Las Vegas Strip hotel, which is named after an Italian comune, was the location of the main heist in the movie Ocean's Eleven?
What "Danke Schoen" singer, sometimes called "Mr. Las Vegas" and "Mr. Entertainment," was the first to receive a star on Las Vegas's Walk of Stars in 2004?
What mountains are located just to the west of Las Vegas, which has Red Rock National Conservation Area at their base?

Fashion Show Drive in Las Vegas is home to a 60-story golden tower hotel that is owned by what family brand? They are known for their casinos and office buildings around the U.S., in particular New York and Atlantic City, among other public service endeavors.

Born in Las Vegas in 1988, which athlete started out playing football at the University of Oklahoma, got drafted by the Dallas Cowboys and named Rookie of the Year in 2011, spent seven seasons as a running back in the NFL, was named Offensive Player of the Year in 2014, then returned to his alma mater as a coach in 2020?
What modernist Catholic cathedral just off the Las Vegas Strip is the seat of the bishop of the Diocese of Las Vegas?
The BHOF, formerly known as Exotic World, is a Las Vegas museum and hall of fame dedicated to what stage art?
Las Vegas's Downtown Arts District is also known by a name combining what number and letter, referring to the block side of the neighborhood?
How many of artist Ugo Rondinone's magic mountains can you visit in Las Vegas?
Heâs no dummy! Which âAmericaâs Got Talentâ winning ventriloquist and celebrity impersonator had a theatrical show in Vegas?
High school friends Ryan Ross, Spencer Smith, Brent Wilson, and Brendon Urie recorded their debut album, A Fever You Can't Sweat Out, shortly after forming what band! from Las Vegas?
The life of Frank Rosenthal, who ran Las Vegas landmarks like the Stardust and the Fremont from the 1960s to 1980s, provided the inspiration for what 1995 film?

Mayor William Briare, mobster Frank Cullotta, and gunfighter Diamondfield Jack Davis are some of the notables buried in what historic Vegas cemetery, the oldest in the city, having been founded in 1914?
Las Vegas acquired what nickname when, in the 1950s, nuclear weapons were tested 65 miles northwest of the city, and mushroom clouds were viewable from downtown?
Before he burnt out in "Leaving Las Vegas," Nic Cage suited up as Elvis and parachuted onto the Strip to win back Sarah Jessica Parker in what 1992 rom-com with "Vegas" in its title?
A Las Vegas native, Evan Weinstock first got into his snowy sport by taking part in decathlons. Which Olympic event was he a team member of in 2018?
Nestled in the MGM Grand, Craftsteak treats diners to worldwide beef courtesy of what celebrity chef and "Top Chef" head judge?
What rock and roll legend, famously challenged by speed limits, entertained guests throughout 2022 in his residency at the Strat Hotel and SkyPod?
What restaurant group, named for the Japanese chef who started it in Los Angeles in the 1980s, opened its first luxury hotel inside Caesars Palace in 2013?
The Tropicana donated a number of costumes from what show, which had been imported from Paris and which ran for nearly 50 years, to the Nevada State Museum in Las Vegas in 2021?

optionalAnswers.text: Harry Potter and the Lost Child

questionText: As far as Vegas historians know, what was the first official casino/resort on the Strip that really made it famous (or infamous)?
What West Las Vegas Casino, itself named for a famous Parisian nightclub, became the first casino to racially integrate in 1955?
What 1943 redwood wedding chapel, a replica of a pioneer town church, is the oldest extant building on the Las Vegas Strip?
What forward won the Conn Smythe trophy as the MVP of the NHL playoffs for the Las Vegas Golden Knights in 2023, the first undrafted player to do so since Wayne Gretzky?

The basketball teams of the University of Nevada-Las Vegas are known as the "Runnin' Rebels" because of their speedy play. The school's baseball teams replace the word "Runnin'" with what other adjective, which suggests hard work and scrappiness?
Before she became known for designing the "Welcome to Fabulous Las Vegas" sign in 1959, which American visual artist was the first female commercial artist to make neon signs at YESCO?
Although it wasn't formally incorporated until 1911, in what year was Las Vegas founded, after 110 acres were auctioned off by the San Pedro, Los Angeles & Salt Lake Railroad?
